job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Topeka, KS
pros: Great staff great pay it's awesome

cons: Micromanagement, issues not getting solved, pay is low, hours are in the middle of the day, employee allergies are not respected creating an unsafe environment, expected to do more and more for very little money. We're often short staffed so you'll do the job of multiple people for pay that is far below industry standards. Wish I could tell myself to run before interviewing. If you do very well and go above + beyond they'll give you a peice of candy. If you don't have bills to pay and can be motivated by a peice of candy, definitely the right fit.

pros: Consistent schedule, wonderful residents, well taken care of facility
cons: Too much staff turnaround, management communication is lacking

job_title: Chief Financial Officer (CFO) in Charlotte, NC
pros: wonderful place to work and grow
It has a lot of perks and benefits.
cons: The other workers a lot of the times don't do their part.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Topeka, KS
pros: benefits, holiday pay, and the residents
cons: lack of communication, management doesn’t work with you, hard work for little pay

job_title: Director of Business Development in East Providence, RI
cons: Somewhat clique-ish colleagues who are not super professional

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Topeka, KS
cons: Its declined since the new owners took over

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Charlotte, NC
pros: Offer hot bar during day shift for employees, potential bonus once a year, great residents and family members, PTO
cons: Most nurses are great to work with, but some of the older ones are fixated on being private I detectives out to get you. Management doesn't know how to talk respectfully to employees when minor mishaps occur, and dont really seem to care about staff overall.Some supervisors hate  doing their job, but want to be paid for it.

review_title: Opportunity to serve in a retirement community where the residents are well cared for and respected.
job_title: Wellness Clinic-HomeCare RN in Charlotte, NC
pros:
1) The facility is attractive. Respect is shown towards the residents. They are committed to quality care for the geriatric population.  
2) The pay is generally reasonable. 
3) It is a relatively big facility with 3 levels of care, therefore you can get good exposure and  job experience in geriatrics.
cons:
1) The job expectations of the residents and management are very high.
2) Terminations are not uncommon. 
3) You will work most holidays

pros: Decent pay for a college student. 10$ hourly.
cons: Very disorganized, managers show favoritism towards certain employees and do not treat everyone fairly. There is lots of negativity, drama and sometimes people don't respect the elderly. It makes for a toxic environment and by the end of the day you honestly want to quit. I personally love working at retirement and assisted living homes and have been for 6+ years. Aldersgate was by far the worst and one I'd never go back to nor want to see my family in.

pros:
Low patient to cna ratio
Pay
Great residents
cons:
Management is not that great.
You are treated unfairly and as if you are lying.
The only time I saw the DON was if she was going to discipline someone or going to meetings.

review_title: First 3 years working here was great the last two was horrible.
pros:
The residents are great.
Pay is ok
Great co workers
cons:
Upper management only helps when state is in the building.
They do not treat their cnas good.
Everyone knows your business, (most of the time before you do).
The feel/vibe of the place is negative.

pros: Friendly community. Management and employees are friendly. The residents are also kind. Good food. Excellent PTO scale.
cons: Growth and development may be an issue for ambitious individuals looking to climb the career ladder compared to other organizations. Depending on your salary, benefits may be expensive.

review_title: A great place to work for those looking at a continuing care facility
pros: Good leadership, great benefit and health plan. Wonderful and kind residents!
cons: Major renovation and construction going on. At times of what is most important is a challenge.

pros: Great opportunities to work in other fields.
cons: Very hard to feel valued by the company
